name: International Rescue Committee
mission: The International Rescue Committee (IRC) responds to the world's worst humanitarian crises, helping to restore health, safety, education, economic well being, and power to people devastated by conflict and disaster. Founded in 1933 at the call of Albert Einstein, the IRC is at work in over 40 countries and 26 U.S. cities helping people to survive, reclaim control of their future and strengthen their communities.
theoryOfChange: The International Rescue Committee (IRC) has a published 'Outcomes and Evidence Framework' (OEF) which serves as a strategic framework for guiding program decisions and designing effective programs. This interactive tool delivers key information on outcomes related to health, safety, education, economic wellbeing, and power through theories of change that demonstrate how to achieve these outcomes. The IRC systematically uses theories of change in all its new project designs to ensure outcome-driven and evidence-based projects. The OEF also includes core indicators to measure the change in outcomes over time. Additionally, the IRC utilizes an 'IMPACT Program Quality Framework' which defines program quality through six principles and supports the goals of their broader 'Strategy100'.
zakatClaimEvidence: The IRC has worked with Islamic scholars and has received a fatwa confirming the IRC as a legitimate recipient of Zakat. We have launched a pilot Fund for Ramadan this year. IRC will accept Zakat each year during Ramadan, starting in February 2026, the month of Ramadan. (Source: https://rescue.org/sites/default/files/document/3747/tuungane2-evaluationfinalreport.pdf)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Strong donor fit, low risk profile, and credible supporting evidence for outcomes.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 41/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Build reserves toward your board-approved target range (often 3-12 months), adjusted for revenue volatility and obligations.
components.name: Financial Health

score_details.score_summary: International Rescue Committee, Inc. shows strong alignment and strong impact, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: The IRC has worked with Islamic scholars and has received a fatwa confirming the IRC as a legitimate recipient of Zakat. We have launched a pilot Fund for Ramadan this year. IRC will accept Zakat each year during Ramadan, starting in February 2026, the month of Ramadan. (Source: https://rescue.org/sites/default/files/document/3747/tuungane2-evaluationfinalreport.pdf)

all_citations.claim: The IRC holds a 97.0/100 score and maintains an 87.7% program expense ratio.
Total revenue for the period was $1,341,268,864.
IRC programs have led to average increases in credit scores and liquid assets for participants.
The IRC's Tuungane program increased community-CODESA meetings and improved villager ratings of service quality.
all_citations.source_name: Report: Participatory Development in Fragile and Conflict-affected Contexts

all_citations.claim: The organization provides donation options that align with Zakat eligibility requirements.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The IRC earns a high overall rating due to its massive operational scale, transparent financial reporting, and high efficiency in converting donations into direct humanitarian services.
areas_for_improvement: Maintaining liquid reserves, as current working capital sits at 2.4 months.
Continuing to scale direct provision models to lower the cost per beneficiary in high-intensity conflict zones.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment for donors seeking to address urgent humanitarian needs, particularly as it is recognized as Zakat-eligible [6]. Its long track record and focus on empowerment and economic wellbeing align with high-priority global development goals [1][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The IRC demonstrates high impact through direct provision of services, maintaining an 87.7% program expense ratio [1][2]. Evaluations of its economic programs show measurable improvements in participants' liquid assets and credit scores, while community programs have successfully increased local engagement in fragile contexts [3][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: The International Rescue Committee provides life-saving assistance and long-term recovery solutions for people displaced by war, persecution, and natural disasters.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 87.7%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach those in need.
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.06 per $1 raised.
Strong financial health and accountability, evidenced by a Charity Navigator score of 97.0/100.
baseline_narrative.summary: The International Rescue Committee (IRC) helps individuals affected by humanitarian crises to survive and rebuild their lives through programs focused on safety, empowerment, and economic wellbeing [1][5]. In the most recent fiscal period, the organization reported a total revenue of $1,341,268,864 to support its global operations [2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The IRC earns a high overall rating due to its massive operational scale, transparent financial reporting, and high efficiency in converting donations into direct humanitarian services.

areas_for_improvement.context: The IRC maintains <cite id="15">2.4 months of working capital</cite> in working capital, which is considered lean for an organization of its size.
There is an opportunity to <cite id="16">expand services to underserved geographies</cite> with limited nonprofit coverage to improve its underserved space score.

bbb_assessment.summary: Meets all 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards for Charity Accountability

case_against.mitigation_notes: The IRC's massive revenue base and diverse funding streams help mitigate liquidity risks.
risk_factors: <cite id="15">Only 2.3 months of operating reserves</cite> available
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the organization's <cite id="15">lean working capital</cite>, which may pose risks during sudden funding shifts.

confidence.notes: Extremely high data availability across all dimensions.

known_gaps: High cost-per-beneficiary due to conflict zone operations

alignment.explanation: Strong alignment for Muslim donors as the IRC <cite id="21">accepts zakat</cite> and operates in critical regions like <cite id="22">Gaza, Yemen, and Afghanistan</cite>.

credibility.explanation: The IRC is a top-tier institution with a <cite id="18">97/100 accountability score</cite> and a <cite id="8">perfect 20/20 rating from the BBB</cite>.
credibility.improvement: Credibility is already near-perfect; maintaining current <cite id="7">Candid Platinum status</cite> is recommended.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a <cite id="3">87.7% program ratio</cite> and verified outcomes, though the <cite id="19">cost per beneficiary is high at $22,486</cite> due to the complexity of humanitarian work.
impact.improvement: The charity should <cite id="20">build reserves toward a 3-12 month target</cite> to ensure long-term stability during revenue volatility.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade A - Verified outcomes and external evaluations

rich_narrative.headline: The International Rescue Committee provides life-saving assistance and long-term recovery solutions for people displaced by war, persecution, and natural disasters.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to fulfill zakat through a high-capacity, institutional-grade organization capable of delivering aid in the world's most dangerous conflict zones.
donor_motivations: Want to support large-scale humanitarian response in Muslim-majority regions
Value high program expense ratios and fundraising efficiency
Prefer organizations with a long, 90+ year track record of stability
Seek to fulfill zakat through verified asnaf categories
giving_considerations: The IRC operates with lean reserves to maximize immediate aid delivery
Gifts support a massive global infrastructure rather than a single local project
High cost-per-beneficiary reflects the difficulty of reaching conflict-affected populations
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fund small-scale, grassroots community projects or those who prefer organizations with large endowment reserves.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The IRC tracks <cite id="23">8 distinct outcome metrics</cite> and publishes external impact evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The IRC aims to deliver high-quality, cost-effective programs that serve as a model for global humanitarian response.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Rigorous evidence ensures that interventions like malnutrition treatment actually save lives in fragile contexts.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Global humanitarian needs in Gaza, Yemen, and Sudan continue to outpace available funding.

peer_comparison.differentiator: The IRC's <cite id="3">87.7% program ratio</cite> is significantly higher than the <cite id="9">peer median of 89.8%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Strong focus on women and girls in development
similar_organizations.name: CARE USA

strengths.detail: The IRC directs <cite id="3">87.7% of its total expenses</cite> toward program services, significantly exceeding the <cite id="9">peer program ratio median of 89.8%</cite>.
The organization demonstrates remarkable fiscal discipline, spending only <cite id="10">$0.06 to raise every $1</cite> in private contributions.
With a <cite id="11">35-member board</cite> and a <cite id="12">97% independent board membership</cite>, the IRC maintains top-tier oversight and accountability scores.

strengths_deep_dive: The IRC's impact is backed by rigorous data and long-term outcome tracking. Their 'Tuungane 2' evaluation demonstrated a <cite id="13">0.47 increase in community-CODESA meetings</cite> compared to control groups, reflecting improved local governance. Furthermore, their economic programs for migrants have successfully increased <cite id="14">average liquid assets to $1,381.80 per participant</cite>, providing a critical safety net for displaced families.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 1933 at the call of Albert Einstein, the International Rescue Committee (IRC) has evolved into a global humanitarian powerhouse that <cite id="1">helps people affected by humanitarian crises to survive, recover and rebuild</cite>. The organization operates at a massive scale, reporting <cite id="2">total revenue of $1,341,268,864</cite> in 2023 to support its mission across more than 40 countries. The IRC is distinguished by its high operational efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 87.7%</cite>, which ensures that the vast majority of donor contributions directly fund life-saving services such as <cite id="4">malnutrition treatment, health care, and emergency response</cite>. Its financial management is highly regarded by independent watchdogs, earning a <cite id="5">97/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>. Beyond immediate relief, the IRC invests in long-term economic integration, with internal evaluations showing that its financial capability programs led to an <cite id="6">average increase in credit scores of 19 points</cite> for newly arrived migrants. The organization also maintains a strong commitment to transparency, holding a <cite id="7">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and meeting <cite id="8">all 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards</cite>.
